Name: Iris
Subtitle: Welcome to Iris, the most immersive all-in-one software for remote control of spirit bears. We offer the best online connection to the spirit world.
When you are ready to continue, press forward.
You can modify many settings, by pressing escape at any point.
*wait 10s*
When you are ready, press forward.
*wait 10s*

Name: Iris
Subtitle: *tuuuut*tuuuut* You have 1 incoming call from *“Lucy”*. Connecting you through now.

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: Hello? Human? I need your help!! Are you there? Please press up/down/left/right in that order to confirm you can hear me and that the connection is properly working.

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: Human, please press up/down/left/right in that order. You can do it! If you are not sure about how your controls work, you can press escape to check the settings of Iris.

Name: Iris
Subtitle: Checking response from spirit world... Connection in perfectly stable condition. You are now ready to connect to a spirit bear. Disconnecting because of reasons, in... 5... 4...

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: What?! NO stop!

Name: Iris
Subtitle: *monotone* Ha. ha. ha. just kidding.

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: Ah phew! haha! Iris is a bit silly sometimes. Anyway, we will start the connection in a moment. But first, let me explain what is going on. I am Lucy, a fairy from the spirit world. We have a huge giant roaming the streets of my spirit village. We have no idea how he got there, and why, but all the spirits of the village are scared and have been hiding in their little houses. No one dares to talk to the giant because we are all so scared! We need an intelligent human who is a good listener. We will connect you with a fluffy spirit bear. You will be able to control his movements, and you will hear everything that he hears. It is quite the experience, really! So, will you help us, human?

Name: Iris
Subtitle: Turn off your computer to confirm

Subtitle: No, human, don’t! Iris is kidding... again.

Name: Iris
Subtitle: Ha.ha.ha.

Name: Lucy*

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: Oh... you don't.. want to help us? If you make up your mind, please press forward to confirm that you want to help us. We can really use the help of a talented human like you! Press forward to confirm!

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: Human, would you like to help us? We can really use the help of a talented human like you! Press forward to confirm!

Name: Iris
Subtitle: Question confirmed.

Name: Lucy*
Subtitle: Yaaay! That is so great to hear. We are going on an adventure together. It is going to be awesome! Let’s start connecting you to a spirit bear now. Amazing what technology can do nowadays.

Subtitle: Yes! You have one! *hoot* Let's test it. Bird, if I make noise a kilometer away from you, how long does it take for you to hear it?

Name: Bird #2
Subtitle: Well, 1 kilometer is a 1000 meters and sound travels roughly 335 meters per second through air. 1000 divided by 335 is about 3. Therefore, if you were to make a loud noise 1 kilometer away, we would hear it 3 seconds later.

Name: Boris
Subtitle: Let's test this!! Luckily, I have a friend who is currently 1 kilometer away from us. Let’s call him and ask if he can make some noise. *dial tones, ringing* yooo bro! I am conducting an experiment and I need you to do the thing!

Name: Boris
Subtitle: YAY! Another one! Let's test him too.  Bird, when something passes by quickly, why does the tone change?

Name: Bird #3
Subtitle: That is called the Doppler effect. Whenever an object comes towards you, the sound waves coming from that object, are more compressed! Therefore, the sound sounds higher pitched. If the object moves away from you, the sound waves are stretched so it sounds... can you guess it?.... yes! lower!!

Name: Boris
Subtitle: Aha! *hoothoot* The final one. Let's test it to be sure. Bird, if I make noise in a big empty hall, why do I hear it repeated?

Name: Bird #4
Subtitle: Easy! That is called an echo! Sound waves are partially absorbed and partially reflected by objects in your environment, such as a cup, a wall, or a MOUNTAIN. So before reaching your ears, some sound waves have bounced on other objects, while other waves reach your ears directly. Since it takes time for sound to travel from the source to your ear, it takes even longer for reflected sound waves, so you hear that sound a bit later.

Human, you seem very talented! I see you are motivated to learn how to orientate yourself even better by the use of sound. So, let me tell you a secret. *whistle*

Subtitle: noooo not science!

Name: Bird #3
Subtitle: If you listen well and practise enough, you can roughly determine the dimensions and type of environment you are in, just by the sound. You can even learn to hear if there is a wall in front of you. The key here, is the effect that sound has in an environment. Sound waves travel and bounce around, and since each environment is different, the bounced sound waves are also different. Let’s call this the response of an environment. Even your position in relation to your surroundings influences the response. *whistle*

Name: Giant
Subtitle: Ahh!! Science!!

Name: Bird #3
Subtitle: Some humans can distinguish these responses, just by making clicking sounds. They listen to the response in the environment just like bats do. *whistle*

Name: Giant
Subtitle: Ahh!! Science!!

Name: Bird #3
Subtitle: I hope this helps! Be safe in your human world, human! *whistle* Farewell!

Name: Lucy
Subtitle: It is time to disconnect you. Thank you sooo much for your help!! The village is now happy again. All because of you. You are awesome! Perhaps see you soon again! *kisses human*

Name: Boris
Subtitle: Hopefully we'll see you again. *hoot* It was nice working with you! Byeeee!

Name: Giant
Subtitle: Thanks, little one, for clearing the forest. Now that the science birds have finally stopped their experiments, I can go home and think what to do with my life. Maybe, accountancy, or banking... or lion taming! Yes... that sounds great.

Name: Lucy
Subtitle: byeeee

Subtitle: *in the distance* Mom!! I'm coming back home!! From now on I will eat my greens like a good boy
